thread.title: Six Britons dead in road crash in Saudi Arabia, Foreign Office says
thread.title_full: Six Britons dead in road crash in Saudi Arabia, Foreign Office says

author: Adam Withnall
title: Six Britons dead in road crash in Saudi Arabia, Foreign Office says
text:
20   Online 
Six British nationals have died in a major road traffic accident in Saudi Arabia, the Foreign Office has said. 
A minibus carrying 12 passengers on pilgrimage in the country crashed on route between Mecca and Medina, according to the Manchester Evening News. 
The newspaper reported that five of those killed were from the same Manchester family, and that a two-month-old baby was among the dead. 
In a statement, the Foreign Office said other Britons were injured in the crash, and were being provided with assistance. 
There was some initial confusion over the number of those killed. While an FCO spokesperson said six had died, the MEN reported two others from Glasgow died, taking the toll to seven. 
The Foreign Office statement said: "We are supporting the families of six British people who have sadly died following a road accident in Saudi Arabia. 
"We are also helping several more British nationals who were injured in the crash. Our thoughts are with the victims and their families at this very difficult time." 
More follows
